intro: Bulbophyllum yoksunense var. geei, commonly known as the Yoksun geei orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its intricate, often fragrant flowers and unique morphological features. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or lithophyte, attaching itself to tree bark or rock surfaces. Its pseudobulbs are thick and fleshy, storing water and nutrients, while its leaves are usually elongated and革质 (leathery). The species is of interest to botanists and conservationists due to its limited distribution and ecological significance.
